sections.title: Problem Statement
sections.content: Enterprises generate hundreds of thousands of unstructured documents daily—PDFs, Word files, scanned images, emails. Manual sorting and routing is: Slow & Costly, Error-Prone, Unscalable. Goal: Build an AI-powered MAS that automatically ingests, extracts, classifies, and routes documents at scale—reducing manual work, cutting errors, and providing full visibility on processing status.

sections.title: Solution Overview
sections.content: We decompose the pipeline into four collaborating agents on the opensource agentic framework. Each agent reasons over its inputs, may leverage Generative AI/LLMs for hard NLP tasks, and emits structured events. A central Message Bus connects them; stateful agents track progress per document.

rows: File-share events, email hooks, upload API calls
Reasoning: Decide priority based on sender, file size, or folder. LLM-Optional: Summarize email bodies to extract subject/context.
OCR/NLP: Use OCR engines → LLM to clean up noisy text. Entity Extraction: LLM prompts to pull dates, parties, amounts.
Model Inference: Fine-tuned classifier (or LLM zero-shot) to tag invoice/contract/etc. Reasoning: If low confidence, flag for human review.
Delivery commands (ERP API call, DMS upload, email alert)
Routing Logic: Map types → systems (e.g. invoice → accounting ERP). Fallback Reasoning: If target system down, enqueue retry or send Slack alert.

subsections.title: Operator Dashboard
items: Upload/Ingestion Panel: Drag-and-drop or “Connect Mailbox” button.

Workflow Progress Bar: Nodes: Ingested, Extracted, Classified, Routed. Each lights up with timestamp as agents complete their steps. Hover reveals details (e.g. “OCR took 3.2s,” “Type=Contract (94% confidence)”).
Document List & Status: Table of recent docs with columns: Name, Type, Status, Last Updated. Click row to expand the live progress bar and metadata panel.
Manual Overrides: Buttons to “Re-extract,” “Re-classify,” or “Route to…” if human intervention is needed.
